body.p: A patient needs to have an intravenous line (IV) placed for medication in the emergency department. The physician wants the line to be placed proximal to the elbow. Where should the IV be placed?

response.feedback: Correct. In this scenario, the physician indicates a starting point of the elbow and moves toward the body's trunk.
Incorrect. To move from the elbow to the forearm would be distal.
Incorrect. To move from the elbow to the hand would be distal.
